oL8K8XbJ_TmNyaDkBgTmPg.text: The rain was pouring down  a typical Edinburgh Summer day. Decided to have lunch here. The first thing that surprised me was that it was quiet even when it was wet. A dark interior with a number of tables and chairs which extend into a second area to the left of the bar. I ordered a cocktail from the waiter but that did not arrive for some 10 minutes. Not a good start! I then decided to select from the lunch menu something to eat. Luckily the lunch menu was a little less expensive than the main evening menu. This does seem over-priced compared to similar food in other restaurants. There was then another long delay before my beef burger arrived. For my taste this was over-cooked as were some of the chips. I mentioned about this to the duty manager, who seemed very anxious and kept pacing up and down, however nothing happened. Finishing my meal  feeling less than happy I had a look at the whisky selection in the room next door. A good range of whiskies, but again, expensive and none at a discounted price. Overall a disappointing visit.

1CB3ipPQZaAGSjtn6SZTFQ.text: Had been eagerly awaiting this place to open as regulalry walked past when it was being developed/renovated ! Tried to get in during the Festival but never any seats as it was purley mobbed so booked instead. The decor is beautiful with lots of copper and comfy seats. Food was excellent, I had the chicken with haggis mash and creamed leeks  awesome and the other half had a fillet steak (for a change) and said it was the best he had ever eaten, which is a huge compliment. Overall would recommend and go back as had a great choice of drinks and cosktails, tasty food and had a cool atmosphere.

sdQZY1UHn3t1m3wJ-R7zyg.text: Finally found whiskey/scotch flights. They have a variety of flights (4 samples from a particular category): regional, best-seller, staff choice, just highlands, extra fancy, etc.

RJvYaWiqfyIzZf3EcAsh0Q.text: Great place. We began with a scotch and cheese tasting, which was very good. I'm not a whiskey fan, but enjoyed it.  The food was very good. If you are in the mood for a burger this is the place to come in Edinburgh. I also enjoyed their Scottish ales. I've read where the service is slow, but we were a party of 12 and they did a great job.

5jnW8cOQ5qfMygnewSEfvQ.text: Had some friends visiting from London and I was tasked with booking us a table. My first two choices were all booked up for Saturday night (I never want my dinner as late as 9pm!) so after a browse around Yelp I settled on Whiski. Looked like I'd be able to give them a taste of some nice traditional Scottish food.  Looks very hip when you arrive - all exposed brick walls etc. While we waited for our table to be turned around we were invited to partake of a drink at the bar. I always hone in on G&T and the barman was able to talk me through their gin selection, recommending one for me with a wedge of grapefruit in it - very refreshing!  We were shown to our table, and (wisely) informed of their 2-hour turn around policy - nice to know in advance but plenty of time to eat.  All of the food was very tasty and well presented - I managed to talk both of my companions in to sampling haggis and they both enjoyed it. I went for the haddock which was delicious and meaty.  Having tried this place on a chance the gamble paid off and I'd definitely come here again. Maybe for a whisky tasting!?

HUFUJrisH06SAd663KvRhA.text: This is a really neat place to go for whiskey tasting, but unfortunately the service here is just horrible. My husband and I came here twice while in Edinburgh for New Years, and each time, we sat for at least 10 minutes before we could get anyone to even bring us a menu. And then, it took at least another 10 minutes before they'd come back to take your order.  We didn't here for food, so I can't vouch fo the food. But they do have nice whiskey/scotch flights. I highly recommend the flight that allows you to taste a scotch from each region of Scotland. It's a great way to really taste and learn the differences between the various types of scotch.  If you can get a seat by the front window, especially in the winter when there are no leaves on the trees, you'll end up with a really nice view over the princes street gardens.

09uE3Gc8inRI_BriaCGyxw.text: With Yelp as our guiding light in all things food and drink this place provides one of the most divided selections of reviews that I've seen on the site. To justify my two meagre stars:  Yay! - big range of whiskies - central location - appealing decor  Nope - service is so slow - seriously, haven't they picked up the message - people are WAITING! - I had a straight whisky, though friends had a cocktail that they failed to finish as it just wasn't very nice, which is something of a failing in a cocktail that you've paid a fair whack for  So, if you're in the city and looking for a drink - particularly an unusual or exclusive whisky - then this is just the place for you, so long as it's just about empty.

f4hnlHWcMeY0tVT4x4H_-w.text: Of course since we were in Scotland, we HAD to do a whiskey tasting, and Whiski Rooms did the trick. We dropped in on a busy saturday night, hoping for a little calming effect before our haunted tour, and they made room for us.  Our bartender/server was great- we told him what whisky types we normally like, and he brought out a flight that was similar enough, but that let us try new types of whiskys. Super nice. I cant comment on the food, but, it was definitely a great stop in before our tour!

VMcIaXIEtZL4pzfRy6NBtg.text: The Whiski Rooms is hit and miss. I've had dinner and lunch here a few times. Their rib-eye steak cooked medium rare is very good so I recommended it to my friends and we went there for lunch. One of my friends ordered the braised shoulder of spring lamb and there was plastic in the dish which is UNACCEPTABLE. They offered him free dessert, however, after that incident I would not return as there are plenty of great restaurants in Edinburgh.

Be4MQp4D5QOavmRzArikQg.text: I took a friend who was visiting from out of town here for dinner on a Saturday night. We were looking for good food, relaxed atmosphere and we weren't disappointed. We were seated in a little secluded area at the back with a view of the bar where we could enjoy our meal in peace and quiet. The atmosphere was just right, buzzy, busy but not too loud to enjoy a chat.   Service was great, a warm welcome, friendly chat but no hovering (i see others have mentioned poor service but I can only say we certainly had no complaints). And the most important thing - the food was delicious. I had the Chicken Supreme followed by Creme Brulee while my friend opted for the Steak & Merlot pie with Chocolate Cheesecake for dessert. A nice bottle of Sauvignon Blanc - perfect.  I would definitely recommend and will be returning.

00vPZJSsZ3xtLL-Zv5p95Q.text: We went back here on Friday night for dinner and it was just as good as the first time. Good service, delicious food and wine, and a nice setting. We booked online (which is a seamless process) and I requested a window seat which was offered to us on arrival. We ate the Chateau Briand and it was cooked just how we ordered it. I paired it with a delicious Pinotage. Only gripe is that the main was so large that we couldn't fit in any dessert, which was a right shame because I really wanted the chocolate fondant. Oh well, next time!

GZVGC_qH7So1SzMpKjM-4A.text: Be prepared for a long wait for drinks, just spent 15 minutes waiting for four drinks. We popped in for pre-dinner drinks and whilst the bar area was only mildly busy it took 15 minutes to get our first round of five drinks - the bar staff were standing around chatting rather than getting on with serving drinks. We ordered a second round half an hour before we had to leave for our dinner appointment and eventually had to cancel the order 20 minutes later despite asking after 10 minutes where the drinks were because we were in a rush.  Terrible experience and I wouldn't recommend this place at all.

UXddqyT-q4haf8fshkfbuA.text: Very very good food, very happy we stumbled upon this place. If you are passing this place you have to eat here. My only problem with this place is we fou d the service rather slow but the waiting staff were really nuve and helpful. But because the food was so good I didnt mind the wait in the end

MY6JzYb79GoWtIuqkMooOw.text: We walked passed and decided to chance getting a table for lunch on New Years Eve. Unfortunately all the tables had obviously been pre-booked or where full. They did however manage to squeeze us in at the bar which we were happy to. The staff are extremely knowledgeable about the Whisky's and gladly talked us through them so we could pick the flight (tasting menu) we would most enjoy. All the flights are very reasonably priced considering the quantity you get in each glass. We predominantly went in to try one of their Whisky Flights but ended up also ordering a shared charcuterie board. When it arrived it was huge, I didn't expect that sized portion for how cheap it was. Great selection of meats and the right ratio to dips and bread. Very impressed. I would definitely recommend and would come back again if I visited Edinburgh to explore what other Whisky's they have. (Visit - 31/12/2014 Lunch)

4Swq9xR1s-Gk_Lr8sT6HDg.text: Ate here on my visit to Edinburgh last fall. We had a terrific dinner - the Scottish salmon was incredible. The choice of whisky flights was tremendous...we picked a flight to accompany our meal and were not disappointed. Staff was fantastic. And I loved the atmosphere of the room.

Y1taA1E5hsd_nlfJ2PbsOg.text: Easily understandable tasting... but probably varies significantly.

qhzYfxa4mXwyyZEkSRjKEw.text: Wow- would give this place 6 stars if I could. Me and my wife went back here twice and had some of the best meals of our lives! Yes, of course the whiskey is good, but there are many places in Edinburgh with extensive selections and knowledgeable staff (duh). But, I've dined out in Paris, NYC, Tokyo and live in San Francisco- so I think I know good food when I find it. Everything we ordered here was lip-smacking, F-freakin' fantastic good. My wife ordered a cider braised pork cheek that she said was the best pork dish she's ever had. I had some hand dived Orkney Island scallops with black pudding and cauliflower 2 ways. I have to say it was one of the best appetizers I've ever had (even though the combination sounds unlikely). Dessert was also awesome, a smokey whisky cream foam with crystalized honeycomb and a raspberry reduction. Presentation for all our dishes was like a sushi bar- edible art but with hearty portions. What can I say? The Whiski Rooms knocked it out of the ballpark on both occasions- cannot recommend highly enough!

mPwgR1-5-s_g93627PDQ_Q.text: I think this is a good place that might suffer a bit from being close to the tourist strip. On a Wednesday night there were two big groups taking up a lot of staff time but we still got pretty good service.  The meals we had were of surprisingly high quality. We shared a haggis which my Scottish companion assures me was properly and traditionally made. I know what its made of but who cares? It was very tasty. Our fish and steak mains were also very good. We had an excellent bottle of Pinotage and the wine and whisky list looked good. I'd go back.

DWzNqvvOHJNmOrPDN31bZg.text: Great lunchtime Glenfiddich tasting session. A little cramped but wasn't really an issue.

UuKW8QQpCbA3AymmQuQaWg.text: Terrible service, the waiter's were lazy and dismissive, and an hour-long wait for some very average sandwiches. A must AVOID.

xWQgTLYUkhz-yjfPA6Frhg.text: The best ham I've ever tasted. I honestly can't lay enough praise on this restaurant. If you are sightseeing near castle Edinburgh or just enjoying a walk along the royal mile I would consider this a place worth visiting. Order any number of delicious dishes, although I'd recommend the ham haugh, haggis or tomato/basil sandwich and pair your meal with a whiskey taster. Fantastic.

4BlASgm971nygyABLtqEFw.text: Exceptional soup, and great value lunch. We'd heartily recommend a visit. We summed it up: "the Whiski Rooms is a tremendous addition to the Edinburgh lunchtime circuit. We'd recommend you head along soon, to sample their superbly superb soupy soup delights."

QdCOBGjUU5C6U4FYOffmlw.text: I had a great time at the Whiski Rooms. The food served was delicious, very nice surroundings, the menu had a great selection, and the service was also really good. The waiting staff were especially accommodating when we ordered the cheeseboard which comes with crackers-being wheat intolerant I asked if they had anything else I could have with my cheese. They were more than happy to help and brought out a plate of oatcakes for me. I really appreciated that. After our meal we made our way through to the bar next door and had one of the delicious whisky cocktails. All in all, a great night and would definitely recommend!

Ws7CW9sVfTGaBGRjwbSCFA.text: Don't believe the other reviews.  Came here while walking around one night and so glad we did. Try to make reservations or you'll have to wait 30 min like we did.  This was the first place we tried haggis and it was freaking delicious. Moist and flavorful and the sauce that came with it was amazing.  Service was great and huge selection of whiskeys and wines.   Portion sizes were generous and attentive service.   Not quite sure why the reviews for this place are so low but this was one of our best meals during our vacation.

QGBcuus6JqGFfYwMFGwlGg.text: Super fantastic place! Both the food and cocktails are firing on all cylinders! It was our first official meal in Edinburgh and it was the best introduction! The food is great quality and rich with flavor. It was our first intro to haggis and we had them in spring roll form and it was fantastic. Wow! I had no idea I would like it so much. Great flavors! The saltiness of the haggis paired perfectly with the sweet plum sauce. The Cullen Skink was a hearty and smoky haddock soup. Mmmm. Definitely grab this traditional dish! The steak and ale pie was great looking and my friend enjoyed it thoroughly. The whisky drinks were top notch! I could have had the Monkey Kilt all night. I can't wait to bring this recipe back stateside. We liked this place so much for dinner we came back here the same night for a night cap. The place is also warm and inviting and warms the soul on a chilly day. So happy we found this place.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

lO81sE-pY4Gwc0qxxDVk4w.text: The atmosphere here is great it's a really nice restaurant but we were a bit disappointed with the food. I love haggis and I found it to be dry and kind of no taste. The sauce for the steak pie was delicious and the pastry was great but the steak was just too dry. Overall I would give it another try but wouldn't order either of those options...

CIUycJXEbkyc5LpX_jYWQA.text: The host literally said 'we dont have any more tables' and just turned around and walked away. Guess they dont need business.

qOXK1gcS1Xzqpe_znvPe5g.text: I can't review the food, but Whiski rooms is impressive for Whisky/drink. The staff is most knowledgeable and the flights by the dram are well researched and presented. The whisky descriptions are interesting. You won't find any ice anywhere near this place, don't bother asking. Nice room, slightly slow service but are you really in a rush? Let them know if you want food or just drink and you will get seated accordingly. Thanks for a wonderful visit to Edinburgh.

2LcxjkrhNRW1xdigtxDH-A.text: Great view, great atmosphere and service, food and drink to match. Location was close to many main sightseeing spots, staff was very polite and helpful!Would love to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky sour! Amazing
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak pie

wE9xbMS6b7D5SFa8uXZy0w.text: Food was good. I got chicken with leeks and it was tasty but nothing special. The cranachan was deconstructed and delicious. Atmosphere is fun. The prices were decent, maybe a little high.

lGwTBKgsdjj2y1pb4LZHlg.text: Very nice setting. Friendly staff. I loved the scotch sampler. Haggis was fantastic. I ordered the single malt scotch flight and I was delighted by the selection picked by staff. The haggis tasted amazing I loved it so much.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis,very delicious. Served with mashed potatoes.
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Wall frames with cool pictures
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Single malt scotch sampler

QmepGX5Lvfn7ZGfogB6Udg.text: This is a really good place, whether you love Whisky or not. I happen to, because I'm cultured, so get on my level.   The staff is very friendly, and willing to answer all the dumb questions us tourists ask. I ordered Haggis because "when in Rome," and a flight of Whisky. I ordered flight #10, "for peat's sake." Stay away if your are not a seasoned Whisky drinker

7odWYQAAsou6JZdjaBgz5Q.text: Delicious meal with a fun and tasty whisky flight.  I had the Scottish Salmon three ways and the venison- DELICIOUS!   Venue was cozy and the service excellent.  I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky flight- fun and tasty
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Salmon three ways-starter
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Venison- wow!  Served over beet root- great meal!

9UeIl3kPj0ZI15XLfTlLVA.text: Overrated restaurant. The food is decent, good selection of whiskey but the prices are a little high. Was looking forward to eating here after reading reviews but the food was the same as every other pub nearby, just more expensive.

Dos8s5gY9oun4YJ-w2sS6g.text: A great atmosphere... A really good selection... Horrible service.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chocolate and Ardbeg...
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A wee dram of the new bottling

Hxt_FeGqmJsgOzzVvoqzcg.text: Nice restaurant and bar that offers superior Scottish food. Not cheap.  There are actually two restaurants bearing the name "Whiski", the "Whiski Rooms" and the "Whiski Bar and Restaurant" - the one I'm reviewing here is "Whiski Rooms", with a view of the Sir Walter Scott Monument.   This is a superior bar and restaurant that serves modern interpretations of traditional Scottish dishes like haggis at slightly inflated prices, but the food is well-presented and of good quality. Service can be a teensy bit snooty, and Whiski Rooms are a busy establishment at lunch AND dinner times. So a reservation is strongly recommended to avoid disappointment.  The decor is modern-stylish and streamlined. A broad range of drinks is available, including a number of lagers and ales - and, as the name implies, lots of different single malts. Again, prices aren't the lowest.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ardbeg tumblers are used as candle holders.
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cullen Skink, a traditional, creamy (very creamy!) haddock soup. Rather on the mild side, spice-wise.
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis with neeps and tatties. Recommended.

Gn2cSodI1c1yOpdU_7wgxA.text: Well off the beaten tourist trap is this gem of a Scottish pub. The whisky "flights" are legendary and the wait staff/bartenders are well versed in each choice - as well as when to add a drop of water or not to open up the luscious notes of each sample.  Their Cullen skink (smoked fish chowder) is the best in town. Even locals rave about their haggis "egg roll" appetizer. They have a creative take on traditional favorites like shepherds pie and their fish and chips (a little dry) was very tasty.  For those looking to bring a bottle of their favorite "scotch" whisky home, the adjoining sales shop is quite adept and helpful in wrapping.  This is a must as you will not find these selections at the duty free shop at the airport.  My appreciation also goes out to their manager who saved my butt by holding a few envelopes I carelessly left at the bar (being obviously bewildered by the selection and a tasting or two could have possibly contributed as well). They were super helpful and couldn't be nicer (thanks again).

ds0vIO-F2oYBgB9uKkjA3g.text: Spent a really nice late afternoon here last fall. We had the very respectable fish and chips and then did a lovely whiskey tasting flight. I fell in love with the Auchentoshan Three Wood here. Maybe my favorite Scotch ever.   Our young Canadian server was quite wonderful. We loved her. Can't wait to go back again when in Edinburgh this coming fall! Highly recommend a visit here.

6lk8dum6rog2yQD9V8vLCg.text: Shared a scotch tasting with my wife . The best part was the knowledgeable, attentive, and friendly JASON who made the experience so enjoyable. We ended up staying longer than anticipated because we were having such a good time ... ask for him next time you are there!

3q7mC1ClKQrrcU__P8ywbg.text: Fabulous whisky and cheese tasting experience at the Whiski Rooms! Went with a few friends for a tasting event on a Saturday evening and now see this as a beautiful staple to bring any future visitors to - highly recommend a visit to this spot for any budding whisky fans!! The four whiskies provided gave us a great range of tastes, building slowly from a relatively easily drinkable whiskey from the lowlands, up through to some of the more peety/ smoky whiskies from the islands and highlands. The cheese pairings with the whiskies were delicious and incredibly well done. I'm mildly cheese obsessed, so potentially a bit biased, but beyond just giving us some great new local cheeses (highlight was one called "old smokey" - if you ever see this in a store, please buy it, try it, and then come back down from your visit to heaven and let me know where to find it!), each one truly did bring something wonderful and new to the whisky it was paired with!  Our guide was personable and knowledgeable - he gave us lots of information throughout the tasting but was also open and happy to answer any questions. He was unpretentious and thankfully didn't attempt to influence our tasting by saying things like "you'll get notes of cinnamon on the nose, and honeysuckle on the palette" - he simply guided us through the process of drinking whisky, allowing us to get the most from the experience, reminding us throughout that each of us is different, and as such will experience each whisky differently.  I went to this tasting event with three friends, and we went through the experience with around 12 other people at a long beautiful wood table. I loved that the decor and vibe of the place was very much in keeping with the whisky culture. A few of those I was with had been to the Whisky Experience previously (another whisky tour option in Edinburgh), and mentioned that the Whiski Rooms tasting was far better done, so go for this one if given the choice!  Note that I didn't eat here so can't say anything regarding the food - this rating is solely in regards to their whisky and cheese tasting events (which are offered regularly).  The whole tasting cost all of about 25, which I can happily say was beyond worth it. You also get 5 off any bottle purchase afterwards (which they fortunately don't push you at all into using - they're all happy to help but not aggressive salesmen!). You could look at it from the perspective of "I could get a lot more than 4 drams of whisky and 8 hunks of cheese for that kind of money," but I promise it's worth it - you'll never drink whisky the same way again after this tasting!!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky and cheese tasting event - highly recommended!!

J9TWRieCbYnjkDoGRGHoRQ.text: By far they have the best haggis in Edinburgh. I was there for few days and I loved this place. Staff were friendly and welcoming and most importantly was the food which was delicious. I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

b9H2XBFhOw6xHKqUo-y5OA.text: Whiski Rooms is one of those places that you think is a bit of a tourist haunt, but also heard good things about it, so, whilst out checking out Fringe shows, thought we would stop in for a quick bite. That was the first thing to slip... time - while we had over an hour to eat, we had to rush eating by the time the food finally showed up and the SR actually had to pay the bill while I finished up.   The SR went for the burger, the Venerable Nephew selected haggis (while in Scotland...), and I opted for the vegetarian version. Bless the VN's description of his meal, that 'looked as if it was doused with hay' (that would be leeks). Sadly, it was a disappointment across the board - bland haggis, underseasoned potato, a very peaty whisky sauce that was super 'loud' compared to the rest of the meal. At least the sauce came on the side and you could pick how much you wanted (ordrown your plate, as my VN did.... oops). Others do it better, sadly. Wait staff were perfectly pleasant, though.

MvLsCzuA2bQSNB5MX8ahVQ.text: Loved the appetizers and desserts. The beet root carpaccio with goat's cheese is excellent. The rhubarb rice pudding and sticky toffee pudding are delicious. Good service in a central location.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiski Rooms
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tea or whiskey?
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Rhubarb rice pudding

4wcZSdVCS66T588C7TvPlA.text: I made reservations online based on the reviews of the availability of whiskey flights.  I am so glad I did.  Spicey lamb cigars were very good.  Not very spicey.  Haggis, of course, with nips and potatoes.  I found the Haggis a little dry but the addition of the sauce made it better.  Knowing what it is made off, I didn't find it very interesting.   Potatoes and nips were carbs and were ok.  I prefer rice as my carb of choice.  This is a great place to try some whiskey flights.  Of the 9 different flights available, I tried the flight of island malts.   It included: Arran 10 yr jura superstition Talisker 10 yr Letang 10 yr A pipette with water is also provided.  Great way try it neat before adding a couple of drops of water to ser how the taste changes. I enjoyed all four.  I would have gotten another flight if I did not have to get up early the next morning.   For dessert, a plate of four different domestic cheeses.  All were incredible.   A great place for dinner not far from the the castle or train station.  Nice thing I noticed was it was not all tourist here, I noticed some locals having a nice night out.  Service was good with a nice relaxing atmosphere.  I would definitely recommend reservations here especially Friday and Saturday night.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. haggis and whiskey flight
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. haggis
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. lamb cigars

4Jq29h6gwN_87s0pnCr30Q.text: I swear I didn't take a trip to Edinburgh just to check out all that WHISKI had to offer. It just worked out that way.   After eating and shopping my friend and I decided to get something to drink but every bar we popped into was jammed pack. There wasn't an empty seat to be found. We left the popular parts and headed down a few alleys and narrow side streets until we ended up here. It was perfect!   Now I think I missed something when I first entered because I saw a waitress serve a table so I just assumed there were people taking orders. We sat ourselves and then waited and waited. After awhile I went up to the bar and ordered there. The bartender was super friendly and didn't seem surprised I ordered there so perhaps that was the expectation. I ended up having a couple different whisky cocktails while my friend ordered a whisky flight. I also ordered cranachan from the dessert menu.   I have never heard of this dessert but it was incredibly delicious! Raspberries, honey, cream, oatmeal, and whisky combined to make a fantastic sweet combination! I was thrilled!   It was a great spot!

A2uhtG8L-4CMG3tCpWPxWg.text: We stopped in for after dinner drinks and dessert and had a pleasant experience. I loved that they had so many different flights of scotch for tasting spanning from the most basic scotches to fancier, rarer ones. My husband and I shared a flight with scotches from four different regions - Islay, Speyside, Highlands, and Lowlands. We had a dessert to go with it and found the whole thing a very pleasant experience.   Although we were a bit chilly when the door opened (it was March) and we wished there had been a table away from the draft, that was the only thing that impacted our enjoyment of the space and drinks.

eQHpH-iNUh-n812V59U4ow.text: Came to the place accidentally because the one next door was overflown. Had a pretty good experience~The burger had good smoked flavor, though was a little bit dry. Haggis tasted good, as well as fish&chips. Salmon was very fresh, didn't season much, but overall good food

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. bar area
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. indoors decoration
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis

jCerujZJBQgGrwZkCPqKHw.text: Had excellent whiskey here. the bartender was helpful in recommending a good one for me, as I never drink whiskey regularly. I enjoyed my Hopscotch; it paired well and was smoother than any other whiskey I have tasted. The bar is bright and you feel comfortable. I wish we had ordered food as well but we had to run! Thank you for a good time.

baY3oWgyaq9QlmATCWknSQ.text: This was our first meal in Edinburgh and it did not disappoint. We started with the haggis spring rolls and ended with coffee and toffee pudding cake. It was absolutely wonderful and our server, Jessi, was a delight.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xXidK08DJsJdwrWnFlbqXA.text: We initially went to the place next door and had a very lackluster time. Didn't really eat our food,  paid and left.  We took two steps and turned into the entrance and came on in.  OMG this place is a slice of heaven.  We ordered Haggis Spring Rolls, Truffle Soup, Lobster Mac & Cheese, and 2 sticky Toffee puddings.      I can't even begin to say how unbelievably awesome the food and the service was. This is a True customer service oriented establishment and the food is literally off the walls good.    Thank you.

WtmEw59XuVyesaySRNJZdg.text: Had an excellent "Highlander" cocktail here with raspberry and local gin as well as the fish and chips. The "fish fingers" were crispy and the fish itself (haddock?) had excellent flavor. I also enjoyed the mushy peas -- so tasty! The chips were crispy throughout, which I was glad for...I hate it when I get soft chips. I would definitely return and try more on the menu if I return to Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. VERY tasty fish and chips with mushy peas. The chips are crisp, fish very flavorful with a zesty tartar sauce. Yummy mushy peas, too.
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Starting with the Highlander -- delicious Scottish gin cocktail!

Fqa5bFQ0HdwmQOI_BBLN1A.text: Very friendly service, great food and perfect place for eating close to city center. The whisky selection is huge and very knowledgeable.

E3vl3pGZNm7Mr_mVBCFGIw.text: A wonderful place with great food and whiskey,  nice ambiance and helpful staff. I really enjoyed dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DOIMRghdYxRmMjqRbILkpg.text: Had the lobster Mac and cheese and the whisky drum cider. Mac and cheese was nice and hot with actual chunks of lobster in it. You could taste the strong cheeses, it wasn't some low grade junk. I ended up recommending the Mac and cheese to a friend who lives in the area.

PRZjzpQFZPu2ktnUTMovvg.text: Had a wonderful time here twice during my stay in Edinburgh. The bartenders are truly passionate about whisky, and I had a wonderful time exchanging whisky knowledge over some fine drams. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Life is too short. Order singles of everything....for yourself.
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

5utdoTrvqS06j8LAO5Re-Q.text: Had a lovely evening here.  Relaxed and friendly with excellent service.  These are people who know what they're about.  Our waitress (Victoria) was helpful and knowledgeable with the menu and with whiskey pairings.  Food was very good, well prepared and well presented.  Very good desserts - particularly the cheese plate - and extensive whiskey selection.  Several well curated whiskey flights to choose from as well.   The room is decorated with classic whiskey advertising posters. Clean and well maintained. Nice view over the park from inside, a few outdoor tables on the pavement in front.    Would definitely return.  Recommended.

ClWDwPJlc5drDCXB6PfYJw.text: We had wanted to come here last year, but didn't make it, but came here for dinner as soon as we arrived.  Nice pub atmosphere, nice service.   We didnt' have reservations, and we were accommodated without any fuss.   Drinks and food were great.  And since it is right downstairs from the apartment we rented, we know we will be back during our week stay!

52sYOlvGVco9JkAMHaC4Wg.text: Excellent menu of traditional Scottish including full steak selection. Have a suggested whisky per entree which is always a plus! Had Salmon, lamb and lobster Mac n cheese after we finished off a healthy size charcuterie. All accompanied with good whisky, they have a full bar as well. Has 2 eating rooms, area that you would want a reservation or sit in the other room which more a casual bar setting. Great views down into the park  Whisky store connected which has an extensive inventory for purchase.  Recommend going here

zyZFAoLdB0bGNVCQ25dGkQ.text: They have a nice interior and the food was excellent, but they really need to work on their wait staff who were far more busy talking to each other than waiting on people. We just wanted a quick snack, so my husband had the bread and I had the haggis egg rolls, and they were an experience not likely to be forgotten. The sauce that comes with them gives you a whole new haggis experience to be sure.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My egg roll haggis
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Loved the thistles on the tables

BXkR8Hqw5tMGjgCxToPFDw.text: Drinks rather than food for me here, as we'd already eaten, although I've been told that their haggis is particularly great.  You're in scotland, you want to drink whisky, well, this place has buckets of it (which by the name, would be very disappointing if they didn't!)  Although pretty full, we couldn't resist nibble of plump juicy olives and lovey cheeses (whisky and cheese tasting is a thing here too)  And we had a relaxed few, whisky based cocktails, and the good stuff solo, which, if you don;t know your stuff, the bar staff certainly do, and will happily advise. Dimly lit, with lights and candles, everything in the place was comfortable and lovely (apart from the freezing draft from the door on a snowy night!)  Would love to come back here and sample the food.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

srernKffMj8MNc8myFNS8Q.text: Had an absolute blast here with my mom. We started out with ciders and a whiskey flight, and felt no pain quite quickly. The only food we managed to shovel in was olives in oil (after a second whiskey flight). The staff was very informative and friendly. I believe the bartender referred to my mother and I as drunkards, which was taken as a compliment, naturally. If you're not a whiskey connoisseur, you must try it with and without the droplets of water. It makes a surprising difference. I do hope to visit again soon! Love, the younger drunkard.

Usmib6v2NuIIQvrGFwlbuQ.text: This was the first place we ate when my wife and I got to Edinburgh. It's located near the Waverley station and the Royal Mile. There are three main areas to the WHISKI Rooms - store, bar and restaurant. We sat in the restaurant portion. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about whisky.   We started with the loaf of bread. It came with a olive tapenade and oil & balsamic mix. The loaf was very good - warm and fresh, but a bit overpriced (5.50). I ordered a pint of the Innis & Gunn - Session IPA and the Ribeye. The ribeye was very good "Our Steaks are Scotch beef, grass fed and matured for 35 days." It was definitely a solid piece of beef. The ribeye was cooked to a nice medium rare. The chips were really good - better than any I had in London. With the wealth of restaurants on the Royal Mile, I think it's worth the few minutes to give WHISKI Rooms a try.

photos.caption: Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ribeye with chips and salad
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Loaf of bread
Photo of WHISKI Rooms - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Innis &amp; Gunn - Session IPA

R09phHUv94JtGbflbp_poA.text: What would a trip to Scotland be without Scotch? This was literally our first stop once we got off the train at Waverley. To the side is a connected whisky shop with a good selection. Prices are on par with most of the shops in the touristy section of town.  The main bar is a good time too. A ton of selections, beer + whisky combos, daily specials, and of course, FLIGHTS! I did Flight #9 (The Islands) and it was a great introduction to whiskies we don't have back home in the States. I ended up buying a bottle of Jura to bring back home with me based on my experience here.  Staff is friendly, there's a ton of seating (it's two bar spaces, basically), and they also serve food (though we didn't have any).  We actually ended our trip by going back to WHISKI Rooms for another pint and a pour because it was so great.
